column4: I can't mount my cd drive, anybody know why? http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/13133/
I can't mount my cd drive, anybody know why? http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/13133/
I guess there should be '/dev/hdb' instead of /dev/sdb' in the fstab
gepatino is right. Try to mount /media/cdrom. This would be the simplest solution.
gepatino : ok I did that, but I got the same message as before. maybe I have to "use ide-scsi" "sr0" or "so" like it says, but I don't know what those are
Looks that your /etc/fstab has an error.
I guess it's hdb instead of sdb
but there's no hdb on the computer any more it seems
Well you seem to have a harddisk on hda wich is a ide harddisk. I giess that the cdrom is also on ide, wich means hdb.
all of my partitions are called sdax
Look at line 7-10 of the fstab.
I think those are left over from dapper
I commented out that line as it didn't work
You have a ide cdrom drive. So with some 'sdX' your drive will not work, because it is a ide drive...
if I have an ide cdrom drive, which I probably do, why does the computer think it's scsi
Take line 12 of fstab and try to use '/dev/hdb' or '/dev/hdc' and try to mount /media/cdrom
